com.i2group.apollo.client
Interface IDocumentUploadServlet

All Superinterfaces:
com.i2group.apollo.client.IServletService
public interface IDocumentUploadServlet
extends com.i2group.apollo.client.IServletService

A set of methods for uploading binary documents to the Intelligence Analysis Platform document store.

Method Summary
 String appendToDocument(String id, InputStream inputStream)
          Appends content to a document that has already been uploaded to the document store.
 String createDocument(String fileName, long lengthInBytes, InputStream inputStream)
          Creates a named document with the specified length in the document store, and writes the specified content to it.
 void finalizeDocument(String id)
          Finalizes a document upload by performing any required post-processing.
 

Method Detail

createDocument

String createDocument(String fileName,
                      long lengthInBytes,
                      InputStream inputStream)
                      throws IOException,
                             BinarySizeExceededException,
                             InvalidArgumentException
Creates a named document with the specified length in the document store, and writes the specified content to it.

Parameters:
fileName - A String containing the name of document to be created in the document store.
lengthInBytes - The length of the document to be created, in bytes.
inputStream - An InputStream containing the binary content to write to the document.

Note: The stream is not closed after its contents are uploaded. Clients of this API must close and release resources when they are no longer required.

Returns:
A String containing the identifier of the created document.
Throws:
BinarySizeExceededException - If lengthInBytes or the actual length of the specified content exceeds the limit specified in the server, or if the actual length of the specified content exceeds lengthInBytes.
InvalidArgumentException - If fileName is null or empty, or lengthInBytes is negative.
IOException

finalizeDocument

void finalizeDocument(String id)
                      throws DocumentNotFoundException,
                             InvalidArgumentException,
                             AccessPermissionDeniedException,
                             ValidationException
Finalizes a document upload by performing any required post-processing. This method returns only when all post-processing is complete.

Parameters:
id - A String containing the identifier of the document to be finalized.
Throws:
DocumentNotFoundException - If there is no document in the store with the specified identifier.
ValidationException - If this method is called before the document has completely uploaded.
InvalidArgumentException - If the specified identifier was not in a valid format.
AccessPermissionDeniedException - If the current user is different from the user who started the upload.

appendToDocument

String appendToDocument(String id,
                        InputStream inputStream)
                        throws BinarySizeExceededException,
                               DocumentNotFoundException,
                               InvalidArgumentException,
                               AccessPermissionDeniedException
Appends content to a document that has already been uploaded to the document store.

Parameters:
id - A String containing the identifier of the document to append content to.
inputStream - An InputStream containing the binary content to append to the document.

Note: The stream is not closed after its contents are uploaded. Clients of this API must close and release resources when they are no longer required.

Returns:
A String containing the identifier of the updated document.
Throws:
BinarySizeExceededException - If the new size of the resulting document exceeds the length specified when the document was created.
DocumentNotFoundException - If there is no document in the store with the specified identifier.
InvalidArgumentException - If the specified identifier was not in a valid format.
AccessPermissionDeniedException - If the current user is different from the user who started the upload.
